default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item scholar's pack|phb}
a {@item shortbow|phb} and {@item quiver|phb} of {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}
{@item calligrapher's supplies|phb} and a {@item holy symbol|phb}

fluff.name: Scion
entries: The mammoth devil stands before the adventurers, he has attempted to claim the city for the Nine Hells but this group has managed to thwart his plan time and time again. In the front line stands a man wearing ragged clothes, an old shield, a rusty sword and a relaxed demeanor. As the devil charges violently, the ragged man makes a swift movement where he channels the power used to reshape reality to mark the devil with a blue sigil. When his sword cuts the devil, bolts of radiant energy coming from the sigil charge the rusty old sword.

Hidden from prying eyes, the high elf stares at her target from the rafters and places a small sigil on him. The moment he sits down, an unseen force pushes him towards the window violently. As the elf drops to the floor with elegance, a dark shadowy blade materializes on her hand. The man has heard the stories and knows that this is his end, those who dare speak ill of the church rarely live long enough to see the sun again.

Rumors speak that these men and women are born with the divine spark within giving them unrivaled power. Others speak of the divine agents as deadly myths to keep their children in check. Whatever the truth is, they are beings to be reckoned with.

Scions do not depend on an oath or hours of praying waiting for the gods to bless their acts, in fact they spend their time studying martial techniques, as well as, arcane texts hopping to one day understanding the language of magic.

entries.name: Religious Origins
entries: While most believe scions to be heretics or even evil beings, most of them are highly religious as they believe that what they study is the way gods wield magic and reshape the planes.

The origins of this order start with ancient archivists who asked the question what are the divine laws of magic? And while searching for the answer, they found that magic has what you might call a language of its own. This language is represented by sigils, complex and detailed symbols that detail the laws of magic and how you you want to manipulate reality. And so, the order of scion was born.

entries.name: Magic and the Gods
entries: Magic is one of the most powerful tools in the world and to wield it wizards translated what are known as the words of creation, or Supernal in some circles, into a set of rules that must be executed to replicate their power.

But the what are this words of creation? Supernal was a language of the gods. It was a universal language, understandable by any sentient mind and capable to do extremely powerful effects. Sadly, mortals were unable to learn the language completely, having to rely on verbal, somatic and material components to replicate some of their power.

After centuries of study, scions managed to find a way to use Supernal to create effects that are beyond any spell found in the world. To use this long lost language scions must also write it, down as the written words of Supernal can overcome any material component needed and this is what scions have come to name sigils.

entries.name: Understanding Magic
entries: Scions do not have natural spell casting abilities, they depend on learning the long dead language of the gods to become more powerful than ordinary mortals. As such, they constantly study strange texts that contain symbols that seem to make no sense to people who are not scions. Studying these texts give scions the feeling hat one day they could, in theory, reshape reality to their whims.

The hubris of scions is that they dream of becoming as powerful as the gods themselves, but can you blame them? They were born without any power at all but their curiosity and logical thinking mixed with their knowledge of Supernal, makes them beings to be reckoned with.

rows: Wizards have their spell books, you have tons of scrolls with weird symbols on them constantly experimenting with sigils.
There is connection between magic and divinity, you will unlock it.
You have hundreds of maps to the planes with you as you seek to understand the words of creation.
Divine, primal or arcane magic, they are all formulas and you put all your attention on them.
Supernal is the language used to create the multiverse, your studies will unlock its secrets.
Reshaping reality is easy to a god, you must learn what is their secret to doing this.

entries.name: The Price of Power
entries: While training the mind is of utmost importance for a scion, so is training the body as their tasks constantly put them in deadly danger. To survive, they need to train every day with all manner of weapons until they are accurate with them, to achieve this they are continuously put in the most dangerous types of exercises.

Scions take this training to heart as even out of the academy they will try to perfect their martial training, the attachment they have towards their preferred weapon gets to a point where a scion does not feel at ease when they are separated it. As such, scions claim that their weapons are part of their religion or even their holy symbol.

rows: Your morning routine consists of fighting with your shadow.
Taking care and knowing your weapons is something that is of utmost importance for me.
Your body is full or scars that allow you to withstand the pain of getting injured.
Your weapon is part of your body, you treat it with respect and can move with it without any problem.
You duel for fun everyday, hoping to learn new things about fighting and looking for ways to improve your style.
A daily work out makes the body strong and agile, you must do your daily routine or else you feel like uneasy.

entries.name: Seekers of Knowledge
entries: Scions are academics first as such, they enjoy studying reading about a variety of topics. They constantly seek obscure information about a subject they wish to master. They constantly carry with them texts that interest them like romance novels, monsters or history. While some read to learn, others seek to unwind from the horrors of the world they face each day. Their interest is such that they might even go deep into a long lost ruin only to find a first edition tome they wished to add into their collection.
Why did you get interested in this specific topic? Is it something you read for distraction or to learn something? Maybe this is what enticed you to go into wilds.

rows: Romantic novels or poetry get your mind out of the problems that you face.
Philosophy and moral debate is something that gets your mind going.
Arcane theory is what you desire, how does magic work and how can it shape the cosmos?
Theology, yes you are a member of the church and as such you must uphold it's values.
Knowing a monsters anatomy and culture helps fight them.
You rather read military strategy and history than any other topic as you its uses in your line of work.

entries.name: Creating a Scion
entries: When creating a scion, think about what deity, ideal or church is the one you serve and how you serve this order, this will help you choose a sacred task down the line.

Once this is done think about your characters motivations. What types of tasks are you sent to by your order? How did you came to learn the words of creation? What weapon do you prefer to use and how do you take care of it? How do you unwind after a long day of hunting down monsters?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an Scion quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on the type of weapons you want to wield. Your next-highest score should be Intelligence. Second, choose the cloistered scholar background.

classFeature.name: Esoteric Knowledge
entries: At 1st level, you have learned the the basics of the words of creation to facilitate you in casting certain spells with some changes. You know the {@spell mage armor} and {@spell comprehend languages} spells. These spells count as scion spells for you, but don't count against the number of scion spells you know. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

When you cast {@spell mage armor} on yourself, you can choose between using your Intelligence or Dexterity modifier to calculate the base AC. Moreover, when using {@spell comprehend languages} to read texts it takes you 30 seconds to read one page.
Once per long rest, you can cast each of these spells without using a spell slot. If you cast either of these spells this way, their duration is doubled.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a particular style of fighting or channeling your magic as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Sacred Sigils
entries: At 2nd level, you have learned how to inscribe divine symbols that empower you in combat.

entries.name: Inscribed Sigils
entries: At 2nd level, you can have two inscribed sigils of your choice, these sigils can be found on at the {@filter spells section|spells|class=Scion (SCN)}.

The Inscribed Sigils column of the Scion table shows the number of sigils you can have fixed in your mind and inscribed at each level. A sigil you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Sigil Level column for your level. When you reach 5th level, for example, you can learn a new sigil, which can be of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the sigils you know and replace it with another sigil from the sigil list, which also must be of a level of up to your Sigil Level.

entries.name: Sigil Slots
entries: The Scion table shows how many slots you have to use your sigils of 1st through 5th level and the level of those slots; all of your sigil slots are the same level. You regain all expended sigil slots when you finish a long rest.

For example, when you are 5th level, you have four 2nd-level sigil slots. To cast the 1st-leve{@spell sigil of harm|Scion} sigil of harm, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level sigil.

entries.name: Casting Spells
entries: Some sigils provide a list of spells for the scion to use, the scion can use that sigil to cast one of the spells listed as long as the scion has a sigil slots of that level or higher. If a Sigil Slot is used for casting a spell, the spell is casted at the respective level of the slot. For example, when you are 5th level and you cast the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Sigil Ability
entries: As a student of magic, Intelligence is the ability you use if a sigil requires a saving throw or calls for an attack roll.

entries.name: Memorized Spells
entries: Unlike other spell casters, scions do not get their magic from and oath, prayer or even their bloodline, to cast spells scions must study arcane formulas to manipulate the fabric of magic like the gods do.

entries.name: Casting Sigils
entries: Sigils are the written words of creation also known as Supernal, giving their powers a divine origin. As such, all sigils, and spells provided by sigils, require verbal and somatic components to be activated but no material components as the inscription replaces them. Additionally, all sigils count as spells of a level equal to the level of the sigil slot spent to cast it.

classFeature.name: Combat Insight
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your experience battling the enemies of the church allows you to better understand what you are fighting. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature's type has to be either an {@filter aberration|bestiary|type=aberration}, {@filter celestial|bestiary|type=celestial}, {@filter elemental|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter fey|bestiary|type=fey}, {@filter fiend|bestiary|type=fiend}, {@filter monstrosity|bestiary|type=monstrosity}, or {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead}. You immediately learn whether the creature has any damage immunities, resistances, vulnerabilities, and if the target has more of less hit points than you.

classFeature.name: Sacred Hunter
entries: At 3rd level, the knowledge you have gathered about the enemies of the church, has allowed you to become a better hunter. As a result, whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) or Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task
entries: At 3rd level, you have transitioned from a trainee into an official of a church allowing you to choose how you serve it by selecting either Acolyte, Avenger, Inquisitor, Magus, or Sin Eater
Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 15th level, and 20th.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Prime Sigil (1st level)
entries: At 6th level, you have managed to master one specific sigil which you can cast with little effort. Choose one {@filter 1st-level sigil|spells|level=1|class=Scion (SCN)} as your prime sigil. You always have this sigil inscribed, it doesn't count against the number of sigils you have inscribed, and you can cast it at 1st level without expending a sigil slot once per long rest.

At 17th level you can chose one {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level sigil|spells|level=1;2|class=Scion (SCN)} as your secondary prime sigil. You can cast this this sigil once without expending a sigil slot at 2nd-level. You regain all uses of your Prime Sigils when you finish a long rest.
Whenever you gain a new level in this class, you can change any of your prime sigils
If you want to cast either sigil at a higher level, you must expend a sigil slot as normal.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Sacred Task.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Combat Casting
entries: By 10th level, the dual training you have undergone allows you to use sigils and attack with a weapon at the same time. When you use your action to cast a sigil, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Instinct
entries: When you reach 11th level, your time hunting down the enemies of the church has trained your body to never be caught off-guard granting you the following benefits:

items: You have a +2 bonus to initiative checks.
You are never surprised, so long as you are not incapacitated.
On your first turn in combat, you have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in combat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Sacred Task.

classFeature.name: Advanced Esoteric Knowledge
entries: Beginning  at 15th level, your knowledge of the language of the god has grown to the extent that you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} and {@spell comprehend languages} spells. These spells cannot be dispelled or suppressed.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Prime Sigil (2nd level)
entries: At 17th level you can chose one {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level sigil|spells|level=1;2|class=Scion (SCN)} as your secondary prime sigil. You can cast this this sigil once without expending a sigil slot at 2nd-level. You regain all uses of your Prime Sigils when you finish a long rest.
Whenever you gain a new level in this class, you can change any of your prime sigils
If you want to cast either sigil at a higher level, you must expend a sigil slot as normal.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Strike
entries: By 18th level, as an expert hunter you have learned where to place your strikes to make them lethal. Whenever you roll the maximum result on a damage die for a weapon, roll that die again and add the result to the damage total. Each time a reroll results in maximum damage, roll it again and add it to the damage total.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Sacred Task.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte
entries: Acolytes are the helping hand of the church, they are the ones you will find amongst the front lines of any sacred battlefield commanding the offense and providing protection as well as medical assistance. These scions have selflessly taken the task of assisting others achieve their goals.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Medicine} skill and {@item herbalism kit|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Divine Commander
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the acolyte is talented at issuing commands to others in the battlefield. As an action, you can have a friendly creature, within 60 feet of you who can hear or see you, use its reaction to take the {@action attack} action or to move up to half their walking speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte Expanded Spell List
entries: You learn an how to cast some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Spells table bellow. Each spell counts as a sigil for you, but it doesn't count against the number of inscribed sigils.

subclassFeature.name: Invigorating Sigil
entries: At 7th level, you can concentrate your power to burst out tendrils of divine energy that boost the attacks of your allies. As a bonus action, you can spend one of your sigil slots to grant a number of creatures equal to the level of the sigil slot spent within 10 feet of you, advantage on their attack rolls for 1 minute or until you fall unconscious.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Church
entries: Starting at 14th level, once per long rest, you can spend your action to expel an aura of soothing light that affects a number of creatures up to your Intelligence modifier in a 15 foot radius. For each creature affected you can choose to remove a level of {@condition exhaustion}, a curse or one condition.

subclassFeature.name: Apotheosis
entries: Upon reaching 20th level, you have reached the point where you can connect to the essence of godly power turning yourself into a vessel of pure divine energy. Once per long rest as an action you can empower yourself for one minute, this transformation gives you the following abilities:

items: You can spend your action to touch a creature and remove all curses, ability score or hit point reductions.
You become immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.
Allies in a 10 foot radius gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier.
You can use your reaction to reduce the amount of damage a creature would receive by {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Avenger
entries: Avengers are the fearless agents of the church who pursue their quarry from the shadows using swords and bows, they are tasked on hunting down those who lurk in the dark and feed on the fears of people.

subclassFeature.name: Avenger Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Survival} skill and {@item thieves' tools|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Stalker
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your training hunting the creatures that lurk in the dark has provided you with enough experience to take advantage of when a creature is most vulnerable. Once per turn and if you have advantage on the attack roll, you can deal additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Avenger Expanded Spell List
entries: You learn an how to cast some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Spells table bellow. Each spell counts as a sigil for you, but it doesn't count against the number of inscribed sigils.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Sigil
entries: When you reach 7th level, you unleash a psychic shock wave that expels the darkness within you. As a bonus action, you can spend one of your sigil slots to force each creature within 10 feet of you into making a Constitution saving throw against your sigil save DC. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage for each level of the sigil slot spent in addition to being {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Predator
entries: At 14th level, you are accustomed to the darkness and fighting that which can't be seen, this allows you to see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet. Additionally, creatures can't gain any benefit from being {@condition invisible} from you as long as they are within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Call Upon the Aether
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can summon the mists of the Ethereal Plane into the Material Plane to protect you. Once per long rest and as an action, you can call this mist for one minute, giving you the following abilities:

items: While you are in bright light you have half cover and in dim light or darkness you have three-quarters cover.
Creatures cannot gain any benefit from being invisible or hidden as long as they are within 10 feet of you.
You can see, affect and be affected by creatures that are from the Ethereal Plane.

Once per turn, you can use your action to force a creature within 10 feet of you into making a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier necrotic damage and it is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. You can only affect 1 creature at a time and can't stack it on the same creature.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor
entries: Inquisitors are the might and strength of each order, they are soldiers trained to protect that which is most holy and hunt down those who oppose them. As such, they are seen as powerful warriors who are stoic and inflexible in their duty.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Intimidation} skill and {@item smith tools|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Divine Fury
entries: Starting at 3rd level, a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest you can make one additional weapon attack when you take the {@action attack} action.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor Expanded Spell List
entries: You learn an how to cast some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Spells table bellow. Each spell counts as a sigil for you, but it doesn't count against the number of inscribed sigils.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Sigil
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you have gathered enough experience fighting that you can gather your power to protect you. When you would be dealt damage, you can use your reaction to spend a sigil slot and reduce the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each sigil slot level spent + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Stoic Guardian
entries: When you reach 14th level, your devotion to your task allows you to stand up even when at deaths door. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Form
entries: Starting at 20th level, once per long rest, you can spend you action to awaken your divinity allowing you to transform into a creature from another plane of existence for one minute, gaining the following abilities:

items: Your size grows by one size category and your weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, your attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage.
Resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing attacks.
Your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 10, as does your maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Magus
entries: Scions who become Magus are students of magic seeking to create spells that use up their resources. While still limited by the amount of power they can harvest from the planes, they have focused on creation of effects on creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Magus Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@skill Investigation} skill and {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Blast
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned how to sheathe your hands in your magical energy to strike a creature with either your fists or by releasing it as a bolt of energy. As an action, you can make a ranged spell attack against a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you and being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
On a hit, the attack deals {@damage 2d8} force damage. Additionally, you can use one sigil slot to increase the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each level of the sigil slot spent.

This feature counts as spell, the spell level of which is equal to half of your scion level (maximum of 9th level spell). The damage of this spell increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level ({@damage 3d8}), 11th level ({@damage 4d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 5d8}).

entries.name: Upcasting
entries: Before you make the attack roll you can chose to increase the potency of the spell at the risk of sacrificing its stability. A number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest, you can increase the damage by any number of d8s up to your level in this class. If you do so, you take a penalty to the attack roll equal to the number of d8s increased. For example, if you increase damage of the spell by {@dice 3d8}, you take a penalty to the attack roll of -3.

subclassFeature.name: Magus Expanded Spell List
entries: You learn an how to cast some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Spells table bellow. Each spell counts as a sigil for you, but it doesn't count against the number of inscribed sigils.

subclassFeature.name: Explosive Sigil
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can convert your energy into an explosion of your Arcane Blast feature. When you deal damage to a creature with your Arcane Blast feature, you can choose to consume a sigil slot and force all creatures within 10 foot of it into making a Dexterity saving throw against your sigil save DC. On a failure, the creature is affected by your Arcane Blast feature.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Arcana
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you have learned enough about magic that you can now create more complex formulas. You can now add any number of effects from the table below to your Arcane Blast feature.

After the dice is rolled but before you know the result, you must subtract the penalties to from the attack roll. Additionally, you can reduce the number of d8s rolled (to a minimum of 1d8) to get a +1 to the attack roll for each damage die not rolled. If your Arcane Blast feature hits, the effect takes place and last for 1 minute. At the end of its turn, the creature can make a saving throw against your sigil save DC using the ability detailed on the table below, ending all effects on a success. If you add multiple effects that use different ability saving throws, the creature choses one.

entries.caption: Effects
rows: Disadvantage on a saving throw of your choice
Weapon attacks deal half damage (rounded down)

subclassFeature.name: Transcendence
entries: At 20th level you have learned how to manipulate your planar magic allowing you to, once per long rest as an action you can enter a state where you are one with magic for one minute.

items: You have advantage on all sigil or spell attack you make.
You take no damage from {@spell magic missile} and have a bonus equal to your Intelligence modifier to your AC and saving throws against spells that target you.

When you cast a sigil that deals a type of damage the from the following list, listed you can change damage type to one of the other the types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, thunder.

subclassFeature.name: Sin Eater
entries: There are those who fight monsters with complete disregard to their own health, living on the edge between life and death. Some are called martyrs, because they live by the creed that to expunge your sins blood needs to be spilled.

subclassFeature.name: Sin Eater Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Athletics} skill and {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Retribution
entries: At 3rd level, you can let the adrenaline of fighting enemies strengthen your strikes to wound back those who hurt you. When you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack against the triggering creature. On a hit, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.
If you have less than half your hit points, the attack deals an additional 1d8 necrotic damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Sin Eater Expanded Spell List
entries: You learn an how to cast some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Spells table bellow. Each spell counts as a sigil for you, but it doesn't count against the number of inscribed sigils.

subclassFeature.name: Merciless Sigil
entries: Upon reaching 7th level, your know how to use the blood of a fallen foe to enhance your weapon. As a reaction to an enemy you can see falling to 0 hp within 10 feet of you, you can expend a sigil slot to coat the blade in the blood of your foe. For 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell), you can deal an additional amount of necrotic damage equal to the level of the sigil slot spent.
While this feature is active and if you are bellow half your hit points, you can add your Intelligence modifier to your attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Hemomancy
entries: Starting at 14th level, you have learned how to use the power of your own vitality to cast sigils. As a bonus action, you can expend your Hit Die to regain one sigil slot. The number of Hit Die spent this way equal the level of the sigil slot regained.

subclassFeature.name: Hemokinesis
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can control the blood flow of a creature either forcing it to bleed uncontrollably or close it's wounds. Once per long rest as an action you can do this for one minute, this blood control allows you to do the following:

items: You can cast the {@spell command} spell without spending a sigil slot.

As an action, you can force a creature you can see within 30 feet into making a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is cursed and dealt {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage at the start of its turn for 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). At the end of its turn it can repeat the saving throw, on success the curse ends.
As an action, a creature you can see within 30 feet of you can spend one of its Hit Dice, roll the die, and regain a number of hit points equal to the result + your Intelligence modifier.

spell.name: Glyph of Judgement
entries: You place a glyph on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, whenever the creature wishes to speak a lie it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is dealt {@damage 1d8} force damage.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such creatures can be evasive in its answers as long as it has the sigil on it.

Additionally, you can spend your bonus action to force the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is dealt {@damage 1d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

entries: You can attempt to revert the flow of magic to target the creature who casted a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 4th level or lover, the spell returns to the caster targeting it instead. If it is casting a spell of 5th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell reverts back to the caster and targets it instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell targets the caster if its level is less than or equal to the level of the sigil slot you used.

spell.name: Sigil of Arcana
entries: This sigil allows the scion to connect to the arcane forces that shaped the world.
As a spellcasting sigil, it allows the caster to use any of the following spells. Any spell is casted at the level of the sigil slot spent without using any material components.

As a spellcasting sigil, it allows the caster to use any of the following spells. Any spell is casted at the level of the sigil slot spent without using any material components.

spell.name: Sigil of Bravery
entries: This sigil allows you to channel the power of a dragon turning you immune to the fear and charmed conditions. Also, this sigil provides a protective barrier around the scion giving it at the start of its turn {@dice 1d6} + your proficiency bonus temporary hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd-level sigil slot or higher, you gain {@dice 1d6} additional temporary hit points for each sigil slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sigil of Charge
entries: The power of a bull runs through your veins empowering your attacks when you rush towards an enemy. Immediately after you take the {@action dash} action on your turn and move at least 10 feet, you can make one weapon attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd-level sigil slot or higher, the damage you deal with the attack increases by {@damage 1d6} for each sigil slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sigil of Charm
entries: When you cast this sigil, your eyes becomes marked with symbols. As an action, you can stare at a humanoid within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. You can only have one creature {@condition charmed} at a time. The {@condition charmed} creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd-level sigil slot or higher, you can have one more creature charmed by you for each sigil slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sigil of Conquest
entries: Your presence is magically enhanced allowing you to force a creature to kneel before you. When you cast this sigil, you can force a creature you can see within range into making a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier psychic damage, is knocked prone and it's speed is reduced to 0. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Charisma saving throw. On a success, the sigil ends.

optionalfeature.name: Esoteric Defense
entries: While you are under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Fists
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} plus your Intelligence modifier. You use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack roll.
At 6th level, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=wizard}. They count as scion spells for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=wizard}.
